str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
